chargeHist.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody A. SPENCER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value does not Exceed $500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.82(1).
  • PTC Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value does not Exceed $500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.82(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To United One Credit Union, Attention:  Shannon Schad at 1117 S. 10th Street, Manitowoc, WI, joint and several with Payton Spencer.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, work search or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same at the agent's discretion.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with M.N., K.P., N.H., D.N., Danielle Gallops, Jay's Legacy Property and Trenton Ploederl.
AODA assessment and counseling at the agent's discretion.
